Criminal Justice Reform

Our criminal justice system needs fundamental reform to be more fair, equitable, and focused on rehabilitation rather than punishment. I'm committed to building a justice system that works for everyone.

Ending Mass Incarceration

I will work to reduce our prison population by:

  • Reforming sentencing laws
  • Eliminating mandatory minimums for non-violent offenses
  • Expanding alternatives to incarceration
  • Addressing the root causes of crime

Police Reform

I support comprehensive police reform, including:

  • Increased accountability and transparency
  • Ending racial profiling and discriminatory practices
  • Investing in community policing
  • Ensuring officers receive proper training

Rehabilitation and Reentry

I will work to ensure that people leaving the criminal justice system have the support they need to successfully reenter society, including:

  • Job training and employment opportunities
  • Housing assistance
  • Mental health and substance use treatment
  • Removing barriers to reentry

Ending Cash Bail

I support ending cash bail systems that criminalize poverty and keep people in jail simply because they can't afford to pay.

Addressing Racial Disparities

Our criminal justice system has deep racial disparities. I will work to address these disparities and ensure equal justice under the law.
